function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increase in t cell apoptosis in covid-19 patients","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Creation of pathogenic strains through synthetic biology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Identification of patient zero","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mutations leading to increased infectivity and immune evasion","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear research on virus origin","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential intermediate hosts in animal species","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminated water or environment as a source of infection","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of vectors and their behavior leading to ineffective control measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cross-border collaboration leading to uncoordinated efforts in disease control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited vector control methods leading to ineffective disease control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on single vector control tools leading to unsustainable disease control measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of funding and weak programmatic capacity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental change, insecticide resistance, and population growth","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate vector control measures leading to the maintenance of robust disease transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historic examples of ’military-like’ vector control lacking community engagement","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Call for strengthening vector control following the zika epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration with non-health sectors in vector control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate development and testing of novel vector control tools","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergence of insecticide resistance in anopheles and aedes vectors","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in the number of entomologists working at who’s headquarters in geneva","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift in vector control approaches to uniform insecticide-based commodities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underfunding of vector control r&d and programmes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate funding for ntds","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global financing shortfalls for malaria control and elimination","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of effective vaccines for vector-borne diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complacency and lack of investment in vector control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of political will and central coordination","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate housing and lack of basic services, including water and waste management, create ideal habitats for expanding ae. aegypti populations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Geographic expansion of vectors and viruses through globalization and urbanization","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of investment in aedes vector control leading to ineffective prevention of aedes-borne epidemics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective control methods for tsetse flies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relaxation of disease control programs in non-endemic regions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of surveillance activities leading to increase in hat cases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Scaling down of tsetse control campaigns leading to increase in hat cases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Delay in eliminating transmission of hat by 2030","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Chagas disease and leishmaniasis transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective vector control methods","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of vector behavior on
